original_definition: 'solar-only system' means a device that is equipped with one or more solar collectors and solar hot water storage tanks and possibly pumps in the collector loop and other parts, which is placed on the market as one unit and is not equipped with any heat generator except possibly one or more back-up immersion heaters;
generated_definition: 'solar-only system' means a system that relies solely on solar energy for its electrical power consumption, including the pump power consumption, auxiliary electricity consumption, and standby power consumption.

Article 2: ‘solar device’ means a solar-only system, a solar collector, a solar hot water storage tank or a pump in the collector loop, which are placed on the market separately;
‘solar device’ means asolar-only system, asolar collector, asolar hot water storage tank or a pump in the collector loop, which are placed on the market separately;
Article 8: ‘pump power consumption’ (solpump) means the rated electrical power consumption of the pump in the collector loop of a solar-only system, expressed in W;
